⚕️Give first dose of Oral Amoxicillin and IM Gentamycin
advises.moreInfo:
Oral Amoxicillin dose (25mg/kg/Dose): $1



Inj Gentamycin dose (5mg/kg/Dose): $2

advises.advise: Keep child warm and 🤱 treat to prevent low blood sugar
advises.moreInfo:
If possible ask the mother to breastfeed

If the child is not able to breastfeed but is able to swallow: give 20-50mL of expressed breast milk/breast-milk substitute/sugar water

If the child is not able to swallow: give 50mL of milk or sugar water via a nasogastric tube. If a nasogastric tube is unavailable, give 1 tsp of sugar moistened with 1-2 drops of water sublingually (repeat doses every 20 min)

advises.advise: 🤱 Treat the child to prevent low blood sugar
advises.moreInfo:
If possible ask the mother to breastfeed

If the child is not able to breastfeed but is able to swallow: give 20-50mL of expressed breast milk/breast-milk substitute/sugar water

If the child is not able to swallow: give 50mL of milk or sugar water via a nasogastric tube. If a nasogastric tube is unavailable, give 1 tsp of sugar moistened with 1-2 drops of water sublingually (repeat doses every 20 min)

advises.advise: 🆘 Refer Urgently to Hospital
While referral is organized, warm the child
advises.moreInfo:
Keep the Baby Warm

 -Warm the young infant using Skin to Skin contact (Kangaroo Mother Care) by placing the baby prone on mother’s chest, between her breasts, turn baby’s head to one side to keep airways clear .
 -Cover the baby with mother’s blouse, ‘pallu’ or gown; wrap the baby-mother duo with an added blanket or shawl. 
 -If possible, warm the room (>25°C) with a heating device.

advises.advise: Keep the child warm on the way to hospital
advises.adviseSpan: warm on the way to hospital
advises.moreInfo:
Keep the young infant warm on the way to the hospitaln

 -By Skin to Skin contact OR 
 - Clothe the baby in 3-4 layers, cover head with a cap and body with a blanket or a shawl; hold baby close to caregiver’s body.

condition: Severe Pneumonia or Very Severe Disease

advises.advise: Treat wheeze if present, if the child has wheezing give 3 doses of nebulized salbutamol for 20 minutes or 2-4 puffs of salbutamol MDI (at a gap of 2-3 minutes between each puff) with spacer repeated every 20 minutes and if there is improvement continue bronocodilators under monitoring.

Advise home care for cough and cold
advises.adviseSpan: home care for cough and cold
advises.moreInfo:
Home Care for Cough:


<6 months: only breast feeding
>6 months: Honey, Tulsi, Ginger (avoid cough syrup)
Nose could be clean with saline Nasal drops (2.5g salt in 1 glass of clean drinking water)
